law.catch_line: Release of records of juvenile tried as an adult.

text.section: Records, limited to the records of the present case in which the child has been charged, of juveniles tried as adults in the Circuit Court shall be open to the public after the child has been indicted and arraigned on the offense for trial of the child as an adult.
Records of juveniles tried in the adult session of the District Court shall be open to the public from the time the decision is made by the court to try the child as an adult.
This section shall not be construed as permitting the release of the child's treatment, medical, mental, or psychological records unless the records are presented as evidence in Circuit Court.
The release of information under this section relative to the child's eligibility for services under Title IV-E or IV-B of the Federal Social Security Act is prohibited.

law.history: Created 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 358, sec. 49, effective July 15, 1996.

metadata.lrc-note: (7/15/96). Under 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 358, sec. 67(2), this statute becomes effective July 15, 1996.
